description: A panel of Democratic stalwarts will meet Wednesday to complete a rule change to allow Vice President Kamala Harris to accept her party’s nomination for president weeks in advance of the party’s convention in Chicago.
title: Democrats Finalize Plan to Nominate Harris Before Convention

description: Taiwanese fisherman Chen Zhi-rong says that for decades it was common to sail in waters that skirted the Chinese coastline. Since Beijing seized a boat and its crew for the first time in 17 years for violating a fishing ban — and continues to detain them — all that has changed.
title: China Squeezes Taiwan by Targeting Islands and Fishing Sites

description: The UK’s new prime minister Keir Starmer has suspended the party whip from seven of his own MPs after they backed a rebel amendment to scrap Britain’s two-child cap on welfare payments, the first rebellion he’s faced in the House of Commons since winning power.
title: UK’s Starmer Suspends Whip for 7 Labour MPs on Welfare Rebellion

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economy reporter Jarrell Dillard looks at the growing national debt. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Growing National Debt Gets Silent Treatment From Candidates

description: Spanish lawmakers on Tuesday rejected the government’s fiscal targets, in a surprise loss for Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez that signals the struggle he’ll face to pass a budget for next year.
title: Spanish Lawmakers Reject Fiscal Targets in Surprise Sanchez Loss

description: Vice President Kamala Harris assailed Republican Donald Trump in her first rally since launching her bid for the White House, characterizing their contest as a choice between two starkly divergent agendas for the US economy.
title: Kamala Harris Vows to ‘Put My Record’ Against Trump’s in First Rally

description: Republican nominee Donald Trump said he’s willing to debate his likely Democratic opponent, Kamala Harris, but suggested he wanted a network other than ABC News to host the forum.
title: Donald Trump Says He’s Willing to Debate Kamala Harris

description: French President Emmanuel Macron said he won’t pick a new prime minister before the end of the Olympic games, doubling down on his call for a political truce following weeks of turmoil.
title: Macron Says He Won’t Name a New Prime Minister Before Mid-August

description: Advisers for Donald Trump have floated the idea of demanding NATO allies spend 3% of gross domestic product on defense, a higher target than alliance members have agreed to and a warning shot that signals even more tension if he returns to the White House.
title: Trump Circle Wants NATO Allies to Spend Even More on Defense

description: Donald Trump said he will meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Friday at his Mar-a-Lago residence in Florida, the latest effort by the Republican nominee to build ties with foreign leaders.
title: Trump Plans to Meet With Netanyahu as Mideast Conflict Persists

description: Senator Bob Menendez of New Jersey has told staff that he intends to resign after a chorus of fellow Democrats demanded he step down following his conviction on federal corruption charges in New York last week, according to people familiar with his plan.
title: Menendez Plans to Resign From Senate After Corruption Conviction

description: French political instability is worrying and could add to the difficulties aviation firms face as the industry struggles with supply-chain constraints, said Dassault Aviation SA Chief Executive Officer Eric Trappier.
title: Dassault Aviation Says French Political Instability Is Worrying

description: Polish women have taken to the streets against one of Europe’s strictest abortion laws in the latest challenge to Prime Minister Donald Tusk, whose long-awaited attempts to loosen restrictions have floundered just seven months into his term.
title: Polish Leader Faces Protest Over Failure to Soften Abortion Law

description: France’s left-wing alliance of parties, which won the most seats in last month’s legislative elections, proposed Lucie Castets, an anti-money laundering specialist who works at the Paris city hall, for prime minister.
title: France’s Left-Wing Alliance Proposes Castets as Prime Minister

description: Former President Donald Trump is disavowing a previous statement that he would consider JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon for Treasury secretary — and denied that he was considering BlackRock Inc.’s Larry Fink, too.
title: Trump Floated Jamie Dimon for Treasury Secretary, Then Denies It

description: Poland’s government criticized the central bank for wrong-footing cabinet officials over the monetary authority’s potential inflows into this year’s state budget, escalating a conflict with Governor Adam Glapinski.
title: Premier Tusk Blasts Polish Central Bank for U-Turn on Budget Inflows

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer told business leaders that he is “on your side” and called for a “new partnership” with the private sector, as his Labour government tries to spur economic growth and attract investment.
title: Starmer Tells Business He’s ‘On Your Side’ in UK Growth Push

description: The European Union has presented member states with two options to freeze Russian Central Bank assets for a longer period of time as it seeks to assuage US concerns over a Group of Seven plan to leverage the profits to provide Ukraine with some $50 billion in aid.
title: EU Eyes Sanctions Tweaks to Reassure US on Russian Assets Plan

description: Quebec will make a new investment of “several hundred million dollars” to help Airbus SE ramp up production of its narrow-body aircraft in the Canadian province, bringing its total outlay to more than C$2 billion ($1.5 billion), according to a report from La Presse.
title: Airbus A220 to Get Another Cash Injection From Quebec Government

description: Donald Trump’s potential return to the White House in November may bring about a weaker dollar, if the former US president gets his way. Some analysts reckon that would be a benefit for Bitcoin.
title: Trump’s Weaker Dollar Pledge Plots Possible Tailwind for Bitcoin

description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer and House Democratic leader Hakeem Jeffries will endorse Vice President Kamala Harris for president on Tuesday, a person familiar with the announcement said.
title: Schumer, Jeffries to Endorse Kamala Harris for President

description: The US government should impose further trade restrictions against Mexico to prevent the dumping of steel products into American markets, say the top executives of two of the biggest US steelmakers.
title: American Steel CEOs Urge US to Go Further in Mexico Trade Moves

description: Slovakia said it could be forced to cut fuel exports to neighboring countries — including Ukraine — if the war-ravaged nation maintains sanctions that have cut the flow of piped crude from Russia.
title: Slovakia Says Ukraine Discord Could Cause Cut in Fuel Exports

description: Britain’s economic growth rate could get a sizable boost if Prime Minister Keir Starmer is successful in delivering 1.5 million new homes in this parliamentary term, according to economists at Nomura.
title: Huge Growth Prize Seen for Starmer If UK Hits Housebuilding Goal

description: Former President Donald Trump asked a Manhattan appeals court to overturn the $454 million civil fraud verdict against him, arguing there were no victims in the case and that the ruling grants the New York attorney general “limitless power” to go after political foes.
title: Trump Challenges $454 Million Fraud Verdict in ‘Victimless’ Case

description: Botswana’s government will encourage new mining ventures to offer citizens the right to buy as much as 24% of projects in which the state hasn’t exercised its right to purchase a stake.
title: Botswana Touts 24% Stake in New Mining Companies for Citizens

description: President Joe Biden said he will address the nation Wednesday about his decision to end his reelection bid.
title: Biden Will Speak Wednesday on Decision to Drop Out of 2024 Race

description: The rules are complicated and financial advisers say it’s important to think twice before opening your wallet.
title: What You Need to Know About Donating to Presidential Campaigns

description: Ukraine’s Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba arrived in China to discuss Beijing’s possible role in ending the war Russia launched more than two years ago.
title: Ukraine Top Envoy Visits China First Time Since Russian Invasion

description: US Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle is stepping down after taking responsibility for security failures at a campaign rally where former President Donald Trump was shot.
title: Secret Service Director Resigns Following Trump Shooting Furor

description: The UK’s new Labour government will meet with environmental groups on Wednesday as it seeks to broker a way to unblock planning projects currently prevented by anti-pollution rules and deliver on a promised 1.5 million new homes this Parliament.
title: Labour Eyes Changing UK Pollution Rules to Unlock Housebuilding

description: Authorities in Moscow offered to pay a huge new bonus to recruits willing to join Russia’s war in Ukraine, the latest sign of mounting pressure to find enough replacements for troops killed and wounded on the battlefield.
title: Moscow Offers Record $22,000 for Russians to Fight in Ukraine

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken praised the role Vice President Kamala Harris has played in the Biden administration’s foreign policy, a show of support for the presumptive nominee who’s seen as having a thin resume handling overseas affairs.
title: Blinken Vouches for Harris as ‘Leading Voice’ on Foreign Policy

description: India said the shipping industry needs to review the training being provided to armed guards because of an increased threat to commercial vessels from seaborne drones in the Red Sea.
title: India Says Houthi Sea-Drone Strikes Require Armed-Guards Review

description: A majority of Africans say they would accept a military takeover of government if elected leaders were abusing power, a survey carried out across 39 countries showed.
title: Most Africans Would Accept Coup to Oust Bad Rulers, Survey Shows

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s new government outlined vast spending on unemployment and projects favored by key political allies, in the most high-profile acknowledgment to date by the ruling party of India’s changed political landscape following a punishing election setback last month.
title: Modi’s Post-Election Budget Bows to Voters’ Economic Concerns

description: But for many Venezuelans driven into poverty, it's too little, too late
title: Maduro Tames 130,000% Inflation With Draconian Cuts to Spending

description: Melinda French Gates said she’s backing Vice President Kamala Harris in her bid to become US president, calling the California Democrat “a leader who knows that when women have their full power in society, we all thrive.”
title: French Gates Backs Harris, Saying ‘So Much Riding’ on Election

description: US regulators are examining how companies including Mastercard Inc., JPMorgan Chase & Co. and a unit of Goldman Sachs Group Inc. provide clients with algorithms that use consumers’ personal data to tailor product pricing to individuals — what the agency termed “surveillance pricing.”
title: Mastercard, JPMorgan Get FTC Inquiry Over ‘Surveillance Pricing’

description: Shipments from Baltic ports are down by 41% since mid-June
title: Russia’s Crude Exports Slide Again to Hit a Seven-Month Low

description: Drug benefits middlemen engage in anticompetitive practices to push patients toward higher-cost medicines and boost their profits, according to a Congressional report released Tuesday.
title: House Oversight Panel Blames Drug Middlemen for Higher Prices

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa has signed a landmark bill that will compel all levels of government to take climate considerations into account when setting budgets and making decisions.
title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Enshrines Climate Targets Into Law

description: The impact of Joe Biden’s decision to drop his 2024 White House reelection bid and endorse Kamala Harris as his heir apparent had an immediate impact on the race, measured in campaign contributions, prediction markets and endorsements.
title: Kamala Harris Is Poised to Cut Trump’s Lead in 2024 Race

description: In its first budget after losing its parliamentary majority, the Modi government has acknowledged the severity of youth unemployment.
title: India’s Jobless Are Finally Getting Some Love — and Money

description: India left its defense budget for the current fiscal year largely unchanged, while still spending more on military equipment in the face of rising geopolitical turmoil in the region.
title: India Defense Budget Drops As Government Focuses on Jobs

description: When the Hezbollah militant group began trading rocket fire with Israel in October, Zoe Sages and her family left their home near the Lebanese border and decamped to a hotel further south.
title: Israel’s Showdown With Hamas, Hezbollah Leaves Evacuees in Limbo

description: Ugandan police detained several protesters marching in the capital against alleged corruption in the nation’s parliament.
title: Ugandan Police Arrest Protesters Calling for End to Corruption

description: Hollywood loves a plot twist — especially one it played a part in.
title: Hollywood Donors Embrace Harris After Helping Push Biden Aside

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Xi Jinping Has Made Himself China’s Chief Economist

description: India will remove import taxes on 25 critical minerals and ramp up efforts to develop small-scale nuclear reactors to speed its adoption of clean energy, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said in her budget speech.
title: India Scraps Import Taxes to Speed Green Energy Uptake

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said conditions for a cease-fire and hostage deal with Hamas are “becoming ripe,” suggesting the two sides are getting closer to agreeing to at least a temporary halt to their war in Gaza.
title: Netanyahu Says Prospects for a Hostage Deal With Hamas Improving

description: Vice President Kamala Harris will launch her nascent presidential campaign in earnest Tuesday with a rally in Milwaukee seeking to answer the biggest question on skittish Democrats’ minds: How does she plan to beat Donald Trump?
title: Harris Hits Trail Having to Make Her Own How-To-Beat-Trump Case

description: India cut its import tax on gold to support jewelry manufacturing in the world’s second-biggest consumer of the precious metal.
title: India Cuts Gold Import Tax in Boost to Local Jewelry Makers

description: Democrats say it’s the Trump-era tax cuts, while Republicans blame Biden’s spending.
title: Why Is the US Deficit So Big? Depends on Who You Ask

description: India’s first budget since Narendra Modi was reelected as prime minister for a third term focused on creating jobs and supporting local businesses and infrastructure without blowing out the deficit.
title: Winners and Losers From Modi's First Budget After Reelection

description: The UK’s opposition Conservative Party will announce former Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s replacement as leader on Nov. 2 after a contest that will run for more than 3 months.
title: Tories to Name Sunak Successor as Opposition Leader in November

description: Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina blamed her political opponents for capitalizing on a student protest against a government jobs quota that turned violent and left more than 170 people dead, saying the curfew would be extended.
title: Bangladesh PM Blames Rivals for Deadly Unrest as Curfew Extended

description: Thailand will seek to regulate its fast-growing cannabis industry through legislation, potentially shelving a plan to reverse the country’s landmark cannabis decriminalization policy following opposition from within the ruling coalition.
title: Thailand Plans to Regulate Cannabis Through Bill, Minister Says

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi pledged 2 trillion rupees ($23.9 billion) to boost jobs and improve education in India, and increased spending for new allies in his coalition government.
title: Modi Pledges Billions for Jobs, Allies in Budget

description: Myanmar’s military chief Min Aung Hlaing has taken over the responsibilities of the president who is gravely ill, more than a week before the junta decides on whether to extend emergency rule in the Southeast Asian country engulfed in a civil war.
title: Myanmar Junta Chief Takes Over Presidency as Civil War Rages On

description: Narendra Modi, India's prime minister, arrives for a news conference at Parliament House in New Delhi, India, on Monday, July 22, 2024. In India’s first budget under a new coalition government, Modi is expected to stick to a plan of curbing the fiscal deficit, while still cutting taxes and boosting welfare spending to keep his allies happy. Photographer: Prakash Singh/Bloomberg
title: India’s Budget to Outline Modi’s Spending Plan With Tax Cuts, Welfare in Focus

description: The Bank of Japan should more clearly show its intention to normalize monetary policy, according to ruling party heavyweight Toshimitsu Motegi in remarks a week before the central bank meets to decide whether to raise interest rates.
title: LDP Heavyweight Calls for Clearer Signaling of BOJ Normalization

description: President Joe Biden’s exit from the 2024 race immediately sparked speculation about whether Republicans could convince courts to keep the eventual Democratic nominee’s name from appearing on ballots or block access to Biden’s campaign dollars. Election law experts of all political stripes are largely in agreement so far that such challenges are likely to fail, especially if Vice President Kamala Harris swiftly locks up the nomination following Biden’s endorsement. But the unprecedented situation
title: Can Harris Be Blocked From Ballots? GOP Ponders Post-Biden Lawsuits

description: Vietnamese police detained five people including a former deputy environment minister for alleged loss of state assets tied to a probe of illegal mining of rare earth ore.
title: Vietnam Detains Ex-Deputy Minister in Illegal Ore Mining Probe

description: Kamala Harris has more than enough pledged delegates to clinch the Democratic presidential nomination, following an extraordinary two-day blitz that saw the vice president consolidate her party’s backing to challenge Donald Trump in November.
title: Harris Crosses Delegate Threshold in Sign Nomination Is Hers
